content: It is possible that Martha Washington may have kept some slaves in order to protect them from re-enslavement. At the time of her husband's death, the laws in some states required freed slaves to leave the state within a certain period of time or they could be re-enslaved. It is possible that by keeping some of the slaves inherited from her husband, Martha was able to provide them with a measure of protection from re-enslavement. However, it is also worth noting that owning slaves was a common practice at the time, and it is not clear what her intentions were. It is also possible that she kept some of the slaves inherited from her husband due to economic reasons.
